alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:24AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Craig, southeastern Rogers, western Delaware, western Ottawa, Mayes, eastern Wagoner and northwestern Cherokee Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 824 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Chetopa to 4 miles north of White Oak to 2 miles southwest of Pryor Creek to 2 miles southwest of Porter. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Wagoner... Vinita... Baxter Springs... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Commerce... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Fairland... Afton... Quapaw... Langley... Adair... Okay... Welch... Hulbert... Porter... Bernice... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 267 and 315. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa; Rogers; Wagoner
